channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump is giving the U.S. economy a $65 billion tax-refund shot in the arm, mostly for higher-income people, BofA says
item.description: "The consumer divide is about to get deeper," BofA's senior U.S. economist Aditya Bhave wrote on Wednesday.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Gold and silver medals skyrocket in value this year. Here’s how much they’re worth
item.description: The 2026 Winter Olympic Games kick off in Italy on Friday, with top athletes from across the world competing for not just any prize, but for the most ...

item.title: Options traders pile into tech hedges after software rout
item.description: “The question is how low do you go?” said Michael Bailey of FBB Capital Partners. “Investors hate software, that’s pretty clear.”

item.title: How Google’s new AI could change videogames forever
item.description: Last week, Google released Project Genie , a powerful new AI-powered platform for videogame design . Project Genie, which is currently only available ...

item.title: I’m a 25-year-old founder who loves robots but too many humanoids are militant and creepy-looking. Things need to change—just look at Elon Musk
item.description: Who’s raising our robots? Teaching social norms in the age of humanoid robots.

item.title: What the latest Epstein files release says about crisis PR
item.description: Another round of Epstein files —approximately three million documents—was released January 30, and this batch included a lot of prominent names . That...

item.title: Mel Robbins: Being stuck doesn’t mean you’re broken. It means you’re ready to change
item.description: Known as the self-help guru whose tagline “let them” has encouraged millions to stop worrying what others are doing or saying, and focus on their own ...

item.title: Are LTMs the next LLMs? This new type of AI can do what large-language models can’t
item.description: Large-language models (LLMs) have taken the world by storm, but they’re only one type of underlying AI model. An under-the-radar company, Fundamental,...

item.title: OpenAI announces Frontier, an AI agent platform for enterprises to power apps like Salesforce and Workday—but could it eventually replace them?
item.description: OpenAI’s new enterprise platform lets companies build and manage agents that sit on top of existing software, blurring the line between partner and co...

item.title: Michael Lewis reveals he’s got a deal to write the Sam Altman book—when ChatGPT is ready to write a rival draft
item.description: Altman admitted over dinner that ChatGPT wasn't nearly advanced enough, Lewis claimed. "He said, it'd be a really bad book."

item.title: Should You Cut Workers Some Slack the Monday After the Super Bowl?
item.description: Employees will call in sick the Monday after the Super Bowl to “recover” from the festivities in record-breaking numbers this year.

item.title: Accountability Must Scale at the Same Pace as Growth
item.description: Accountability systems replace assumptions with evidence.

item.title: New Report Reveals Gen‑Z’s Surprising Approach to AI Is Reshaping the Future of Work
item.description: AI use at work creates both challenges and opportunities.

item.title: How Willie Nelson’s THC Beverage Became an $80 Million Business in 1 Year
item.description: Launched by the 92-year-old country music legend, Willie’s Remedy+ wants to become the Olipop of THC.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Gives Firm Answer on ‘Bitcoin Bailout’ Amid Crypto Crash
item.description: Treasury secretary Scott Bessent said he doesn’t have the power to bail out Bitcoin.
